Source code

  1. #!/usr/bin/env bash
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*              Anil Madhavapeddy, OCaml Labs                             *
  7. #*                                                                        *
  8. #*   Copyright 2014 Institut National de Recherche en Informatique et     *
  9. #*     en Automatique.                                                    *
  10. #*                                                                        *
  11. #*   All rights reserved.  This file is distributed under the terms of    *
  12. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  13. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  14. #*                                                                        *
  15. #**************************************************************************

  17. set -xe

  19. PREFIX=~/local

  21. MAKE="make $MAKE_ARG"
  22. SHELL=dash

  24. MAKE_WARN="$MAKE --warn-undefined-variables"

  26. export PATH=$PREFIX/bin:$PATH

  28. ‌Configure () {
  29.   mkdir -p $PREFIX
  30.   cat<<EOF
  31. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  32. This test builds the OCaml compiler distribution with your pull request
  33. and runs its testsuite.
  34. Failing to build the compiler distribution, or testsuite failures are
  35. critical errors that must be understood and fixed before your pull
  36. request can be merged.
  37. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  38. EOF

  40.   configure_flags="\
  41.     --prefix=$PREFIX \
  42.     --enable-debug-runtime \
  43.     $CONFIG_ARG"

  45.   case $XARCH in
  46.   x64)
  47.     ./configure $configure_flags
  48.     ;;
  49.   i386)
  50.     ./configure --build=x86_64-pc-linux-gnu --host=i386-pc-linux-gnu \
  51.       $configure_flags
  52.     ;;
  53.   *)
  54.     echo unknown arch
  55.     exit 1
  56.     ;;
  57.   esac
  58. }

  60. ‌Build () {
  61.   if [ "$(uname)" = 'Darwin' ]; then
  62.     script -q build.log $MAKE_WARN
  63.   else
  64.     script --return --command "$MAKE_WARN" build.log
  65.   fi
  66.   failed=0
  67.   if grep -Fq ' warning: undefined variable ' build.log; then
  68.     echo Undefined Makefile variables detected
  69.     failed=1
  70.   fi
  71.   rm build.log
  72.   echo Ensuring that all names are prefixed in the runtime
  73.   if ! ./tools/check-symbol-names runtime/*.a otherlibs/*/lib*.a ; then
  74.     failed=1
  75.   fi
  76.   if ((failed)); then
  77.     exit 1
  78.   fi
  79. }

  81. ‌Test () {
  82.   echo Running the testsuite
  83.   $MAKE -C testsuite parallel
  84.   cd ..
  85. }

  87. # By default, TestPrefix will attempt to run the tests
  88. # in the given directory in parallel.
  89. ‌TestPrefix () {
  90.   TO_RUN=parallel-"$1"
  91.   echo Running single testsuite directory with $TO_RUN
  92.   $MAKE -C testsuite $TO_RUN
  93.   cd ..
  94. }

  96. ‌API_Docs () {
  97.   echo Ensuring that all library documentation compiles
  98.   $MAKE -C api_docgen html pdf texi
  99. }

  101. ‌Install () {
  102.   $MAKE install
  103. }

  105. ‌Checks () {
  106.   if fgrep 'SUPPORTS_SHARED_LIBRARIES=true' Makefile.config &>/dev/null ; then
  107.     echo Check the code examples in the manual
  108.     $MAKE manual-pregen
  109.   fi
  110.   # check_all_arches checks tries to compile all backends in place,
  111.   # we would need to redo (small parts of) world.opt afterwards to
  112.   # use the compiler again
  113.   $MAKE check_all_arches
  114.   # Ensure that .gitignore is up-to-date - this will fail if any untreacked or
  115.   # altered files exist.
  116.   test -z "$(git status --porcelain)"
  117.   # check that the 'clean' target also works
  118.   $MAKE clean
  119.   $MAKE -C manual clean
  120.   $MAKE -C manual distclean
  121.   # check that the `distclean` target definitely cleans the tree
  122.   $MAKE distclean
  123.   # Check the working tree is clean
  124.   test -z "$(git status --porcelain)"
  125.   # Check that there are no ignored files
  126.   test -z "$(git ls-files --others -i --exclude-standard)"
  127. }

  129. ‌CheckManual () {
  130.       cat<<EOF
  131. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  132. This test checks the global structure of the reference manual
  133. (e.g. missing chapters).
  134. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  135. EOF
  136.   # we need some of the configuration data provided by configure
  137.   ./configure
  138.   $MAKE check-stdlib check-case-collision -C manual/tests

  140. }

  142. ‌BuildManual () {
  143.   $MAKE -C manual/src/html_processing duniverse
  144.   $MAKE -C manual manual
  145.   $MAKE -C manual web
  146. }

  148. # ReportBuildStatus accepts an exit code as a parameter (defaults to 1) and also
  149. # instructs GitHub Actions to set build-status to 'failed' on non-zero exit or
  150. # 'success' otherwise.
  151. ‌ReportBuildStatus () {
  152.   CODE=${1:-1}
  153.   if ((CODE)); then
  154.     STATUS='failed'
  155.   else
  156.     STATUS='success'
  157.   fi
  158.   echo "build-status=$STATUS" >>"$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
  159.   exit $CODE
  160. }

  162. ‌BasicCompiler () {
  163.   trap ReportBuildStatus ERR

  165.   ./configure --disable-dependency-generation \
  166.               --disable-debug-runtime \
  167.               --disable-instrumented-runtime

  169.   # Need a runtime
  170.   make -j coldstart
  171.   # And generated files (ocamllex compiles ocamlyacc)
  172.   make -j ocamllex

  174.   ReportBuildStatus 0
  175. }

  177. case $1 in
  178. configure) Configure;;
  179. build) Build;;
  180. test) Test;;
  181. test_prefix) TestPrefix $2;;
  182. api-docs) API_Docs;;
  183. install) Install;;
  184. manual) BuildManual;;
  185. other-checks) Checks;;
  186. basic-compiler) BasicCompiler;;
  187. *) echo "Unknown CI instruction: $1"
  188.    exit 1;;
  189. esac
